solution.text:
Given vertices are: A(_{i}_,_{j}_), B(_{k}_,_{l}_), C(_{m}_,_{n}_) and D(_{o}_,_{p}_).
In the given quadrilateral join B and D. which will give two triangles ABD and BCD
Therefore, area of quadrilateral = area of ABD + area of BCD.
Now Using following formula:
Area of ABD = \({1\over 2}\times (x_1(y_2-y_3)+x_2(y_3-y_1)+x_3(y_1-y_2))\)
i.e., Area of ABD = \({1\over 2}\times (_{i}_(_{l}_-_{p}_)+_{k}_(_{p}_-_{j}_)+_{o}_(_{j}_-_{l}_))\)
i.e., Area of ABD = \({1\over 2}\times (_{i}_(_{{l-p}}_)+_{k}_(_{{p-j}}_)+_{o}_(_{{j-l}}_))\)
i.e.,Area of ABD = \({1\over 2}\times (_{{i*(l-p)}}_+_{{k*(p-j)}}_+_{{(j-l)*o}}_)\)
i.e., Area of ABD = \({1\over 2}\times (_{{(i*(l-p))+(k*(p-j))+((j-l)*o)}}_)\)
i.e., Area of ABD = _{{trunc(((Decimal(i)*(l-p))+(k*(p-j))+((j-l)*o))/2,2)}}_
Similarly,
i.e., Area of BCD = \({1\over 2}\times (_{k}_(_{n}_-_{p}_)+_{m}_(_{p}_-_{l}_)+_{o}_(_{l}_-_{n}_))\)
i.e., Area of BCD = \({1\over 2}\times (_{k}_(_{{n-p}}_)+_{m}_(_{{p-l}}_)+_{o}_(_{{l-n}}_))\)
i.e.,Area of BCD = \({1\over 2}\times (_{{k*(n-p)}}_+_{{m*(p-l)}}_+_{{(l-n)*o}}_)\)
i.e., Area of BCD = \({1\over 2}\times (_{{(k*(n-p))+(m*(p-l))+((l-n)*o)}}_)\)
i.e., Area of BCD = _{{trunc(((Decimal(k)*(n-p))+(m*(p-l))+((l-n)*o))/2,2)}}_
Therefore,
Area of ABCD = _{{trunc(((Decimal(i)*(l-p))+(k*(p-j))+((j-l)*o))/2,2)}}_ + _{{trunc(((Decimal(k)*(n-p))+(m*(p-l))+((l-n)*o))/2,2)}}_
Area of ABCD = _{{trunc(((Decimal(i)*(l-p))+(k*(p-j))+((j-l)*o))/2,2)+trunc(((Decimal(k)*(n-p))+(m*(p-l))+((l-n)*o))/2,2)}}_

content.text:
Find the area of quadrilateral whose vertices are in following order :
A(_{i}_,_{j}_), B(_{k}_,_{l}_), C(_{m}_,_{n}_) and D(_{o}_,_{p}_).
